DOC.brief_summary: The purpose trial evaluate long-term ( 24 week ) efficacy prucalopride versus placebo subject age 18 year old chronic constipation .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Long-term Prucalopride Treatment With Chronic Constipation Subjects Aged ≥ 18 Years
DOC.detailed_description: In phase IV trial total 340 subject ( 170 subject per treatment group ) , chronic constipation , plan randomly assign double-blind treatment . The trial duration subject 26 28 week total , include 2- 4-week run-in phase follow 24-week double-blind treatment phase . The patient complete e-diary . Adult subject ( ≥18 < 65 year age ) take 2 mg prucalopride match placebo throughout entire 24-week treatment period . Elderly subject ( ≥65 year age ) start dose 1 mg prucalopride match placebo . In case insufficient response daily dose increased 2 mg ( i.e . change 2 mg prucalopride match placebo ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Subject male nonpregnant , nonbreastfeeding female outpatient ≥18 year age ( upper age limit ) . 2 . Subject history constipation . The subject report average ≤2 SBM/week result feel complete evacuation ( SCBM ) . 3 . Subject agree stop his/her current laxative treatment willing use rescue medication accord rescue rule [ bisacodyl/enemas ] . 1 . Subjects constipation think druginduced 2 . Subjects use disallowed medication . 3 . Subjects previously use prucalopride . 4 . Subjects suffer secondary cause chronic constipation .
